article_title: 200,000 Preventable Deaths A Year: Numbers That Cry Out For Action -- And Better Reporting

article_metadata.author: Rob Waters

og.description: A new study released yesterday found that almost 200,000 preventable deaths occur each year in the U.S. from heart disease and stroke—about one-fourth of all cardiovascular deaths. In order to understand what this means for the health of our country, we need to a hard look at the social and environmental conditions that help explain the findings—as well as some explanation of what it might take to really change things and prevent large numbers of needless deaths.
og.title: 200,000 Preventable Deaths A Year: Numbers That Cry Out For Action -- And Better Reporting
